Reviews.Title: “Retro...and not in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: Ge0rgiaM0m
Reviews.Content: Flashback to 1970!!! Traveled to Puerto Rico on business last week and needed to spend one night in a hotel in San Juan close to the airport. Sure, it was cheap, but you get what you pay for. Upon entering the lobby the stench was overwhelming...maybe the hotel was experiencing sewer problems? I don't know, but my co-worker and I both gagged. The ladies at the front desk were very pleasant and helpful, really the brightest spot in the hotel experience. Check-in was easy and quick. Onto the room---I think the Brady Bunch probably stayed in this hotel at some point. Brown, harvest gold, and orange!! Are you serious? The bedspread and matching curtains were nylon. The carpet was worn and frayed. The bathroom was by far the most dated part of the room. There was a bottle opener on the back of the bathroom door! My colleague is younger then me and didn't even know what it was when I asked him if he had seen it. The glaze in the tub was worn off where one would stand to take a shower, and that was all one would be doing because the handle on the drain was MISSING! To avoid re-glazing the tub a rubber bath mat had been placed over the area. I watched paint chips float around my feet while I was in the shower, as the drain in the tub was very, very slow. No washcloths and no hand towels. I would add that the room was clean and smelled okay. The bed was comfortable and the A/C worked well. If you are looking for a cheap hotel close to the airport this is your place. I personally would never stay here again and I certainly will not listen to the guy that 'recommended' this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Sick!”
Reviews.Author: Annie571
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like a scary movie that had come to life. The toilet and bathtub were pinkish brown...very old and not well maintained. The were long black hairs on the wall, tub and floor. The shower didn't drain so the water was up to your mid-calf by the time you took a shower. The customer service was a joke, on the counter in the bathroom was a sign that said, Oops, forgot something, just call us and we can help. Well, we needed a toothbrush and so we called and asked if they had a toothbrush and they just said "no" like we were crazy. Then we asked if they had a razor and they person said, "where the hell is your stuff"! My son just kinda laughed and then explained that the sign said you could get this stuff if you need it. I had read the reviews on tripadvisor before I booked the hotel, and they all seemed pretty good. Now I just think the bad ones get pulled.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Miguel A
Reviews.Content: Good service, clean rooms, near the beach, and airport, very good location. It has nice pool, Breakfast is served in the restaurant on the top floor where you can enjoy a beautiful sight of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Beachy722Maryland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night on our recent visit to Puerto Rico before traveling to another location. Once there, we found that it was at a good location across from the beach. I chose this hotel because it was close to the airport, had parking available at a $6.96 daily charge, and included a continental breakfast. Upon entering the hotel, we found an attractive lobby and were greeted by a very helpful staff member. While checking in, I mentioned to my husband that I was thirsty, and the hotel staff member immediately offered me a bottle of water. Although we didn't have time to use the pool, it looked very nice. The room was small, nicely appointed, but it did have a slight odor. The elevator is very small and slow. The one thing that was disappointing was the continental breakfast. This hotel was a bit more expensive then some of the others that I looked at, but I thought that having breakfast available to us would save us some time in the morning. It was probably the worst continental breakfast that I have ever seen at a hotel. We got to the breakfast between 8:30 and 9:00, and the fruit was gone, and didn't get refilled. What was left, had no taste at all. The coffee cups must have been the smallest that they could buy. I couldn't find water for tea and had to ask for it. They did have orange juice, and a few pastries and muffins, but we just ended up having toast with jelly as it seemed to be the best from the choices available.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a quick stopover”
Reviews.Author: N&YinNJ
Reviews.Content: First impressions mean alot so when you encounter that musty, moldy smell in the foyer... well...Check in staff very helpful and it's treat to see the outdoor pool right off the main foyer. Parking is $6 a day (reasonable) and immediately behind the hotel. We were in a street-facing, 3rd story room. Room is small, with two double beds, a desk, mini-fridge and microwave. Tiny window, not so much light but we weren't there to hang out in the room anyway. Bathroom OK. Didn't need to use the AC because the evenings were cool enough - just left the window open a crack. Which brings me to the evening noises: between the cars jacked up with sound systems worthy of a rock concert venue, the garbage trucks, and the hot shots revving between speed bumps, it was (for me - a light sleeper) a sketchy two nights of sleep. My husband heard nothing. The hotel is across the street from beautiful beaches and we had some lovely strolls. Breakfast is standard fare - mostly carbs - some fruit, juice etc. The view from the 10th floor where they serve it is worth having a linger. Not sure I'd stay there (on that level/street orientation) again unless I absolutely had no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “SO SO Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaptainNorm
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nothing spectular. It was clean but needed a newer look in the rooms.The pool area was great as well as the lobby and sitting area.The staff was excellent. A great location only 12 minutes from the airport and the beach was across the street with easy acess.Nice restaurants in walking distance.My only complaint was the maid service left a lot to be desired, and the two rooms I stayed in diffently needed new carpeting.Our first room had no view due to a big Hi-rise blocking it but on our second stay we had an end room with a great view ,so ask for a end room if you want a view ,would I go back YES Good Value .The buffet breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kss1947
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and only returned because the web site said or was remolded. Our room and bath were old and our bedding was damp. We were on the 7th floor. During the night a roach walking on us awoke us! They no longer serve a cook to order breakfest and their great long lounge bar has been removed and a hot pizza place has been added. The front desk clerk did not know where the business center was printing off boarding passes. Our group had 3 rooms, one worse then the other. My recommendation is spend a little more money and go down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: zxd
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a room on the 8th floor during our visit. It was clean and quiet, and comes with a microwave oven and a fridge, which is quite convenient. The lady at the front desk was very attentive to our needs and requests. Considering the location and the price, I would definitely go back to the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: glitter27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really great it's close to so many night outings ,beaches extc. The emplyees really know how to treat a guest

Reviews.Title: “Howard Johnson the best”
Reviews.Author: glitter27
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say Thank You for your kind hospitality excellent hotel , the rooms were always clean ,roomservice excellent , the employees were awesome they really know how to treat a guest and most of all good prices and it's near to so many night outings .Thank you Estela (if I had to rate it I would rate it a 10 )Howard Johnson in Isla Verde Of Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but typical HoJo”
Reviews.Author: firebirdgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. We were given a room on the 3rd floor, overlooking the street/ocean. Room had a fridge, which we used to house bottled water, which was great. However, the fridge was still full from the last guests food items and expired milk (ick!), which we had to clean out ourselves in order to utilize the fridge. Rooms are carpeted, which is a surprise, as I thought it would be easier for a hotel across the street from a beach to clean tracked-in sand with tile floors. Towels were clean, but sparse, with only 2-3 bath towels, 1 hand towel and 1 wash cloth per day for the room. Basics were provided for the bathroom (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and sometimes mouthwash). Sheets were clean but thin. Bed was somewhat comfy. Maid kept the bathtub clean each day (free of all the hair, sand, etc). Was pretty much what I expected staying at an older HoJo. I would even compare the room quality to the Coqui Inn across the highway from this hotel (I've stayed there too). What sets this HoJo apart are the staff (beyond friendly), the location (right across from the beach access!), and the breakfast. Breakfast consisted of hot oatmeal, fruit, various cereals, toast (white or wheat, with butter or jelly), pastries, muffins, OJ, apple juice, water, milk, tea and coffee. Would I rather have a big pancake breakfast? Sure. But for free, I am not going to complain. Be sure to bring a dollar or two to tip the waitstaff in the morning, as they bust their butt to try to keep the food stocked and tables clean. Note that the later in the morning you go to breakfast, the less likely you are to find everything in stock. There are multiple reasons why it is great to have your hotel so close to the beach: You spend less time walking and more time enjoying the sun; you can run inside if you forgot something, have to go to the bathroom, or if a sudden torrential downpour occurrs outside; and you are close to all of the other touristy bars, restaurants, and casinos without paying an arm and a leg for a room at those casino hotels. Was it a luxurious hotel? No, of course not. But if all you are looking for is a hotel right across the street from the beach to sleep and shower in, with the added bonus of a free breakfast, at a reasonable rate, consider this one. We bought this hotel reservation as part of a vacation package through one of the discount websites (William Shatner anyone?), so be aware that the hotel charged us an additonal amount for taxes when we checked in, so take that into consideration when price comparing.

Reviews.Title: “watch what room you are assigned”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynBoider
Reviews.Content: I stayed there twice- at the beginning and at the end of a group tour.The first time was on an upper floor (8th)and the room was decent with a view of the ocean.The second time we were on the 4th floor - Rm 409. The moldy odor hits you the minute you step off the elevator.Everything in the room was old and smelly.The pillows, bedspread, rug, refrigerator smelled as did the bathroom which was peeling.Some in our group refused to accept their rooms and waited hours until another was available. There was a large group of staff from a cruise ship that arrived right before us and maybe we got bumped to these awful rooms.They had lots of heavy luggage which probably caused the elevator to break-which was not repaired even 2 days later and we had to use a filthy service elevator.When we requested another room on the last day they didn't even have the decency to give us a room facing the ocean-we got a parking lot facing room on the 7th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: Johnny S
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced, centrally located, friendly staff. Didn't care about the breakfast, but I am an eggs & bacon king of guy. If you lioke continental bfst, then it's O.K.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good price!”
Reviews.Author: Mildred R
Reviews.Content: Me and my two girls (5,7) went to Puerto Rico for the Christmas break. We had a wonderful time. On the day of our departure we encountered a lot of traffic on our way to the airport and we missed our flight. I immediately called my family and they turned around and picked us up. I remember seen this hotel on our way to the airport, so we drove over and I explained what had happened to the guy at the front desk and that I only needed one night because we were flying out the very next day...right then and there they took care of me, my girls and my family. They have Great Rates, continental breakfast (which is served on the 10th floor overlooking the beach on one side and the city on the other) pool, and a great italian restaurant on site. Above all that, the service and attention to detail from Ramon Echevarria and the rest of the staff at the HOJO Isla Verde were AWESOME!!! We will be using this hotel again during our summer vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Avidtraveler2
Reviews.Content: I would probably give this hotel 3.5 stars - overall. First of all, we liked the beautiful partial ocean view and nice balcony on the 8th floor. Rooms on lower floors do not have balconies. Another plus is that theÂ beach is right across the hotel which is really convenient. There is also a bus stop pretty close to the hotel if one wants to visit the heart of San Juan or the Old San Juan area without a car. We did try this one day and it seemed fairly convenient and cheap. Walgreens down the street was really convenient to get snacks/drinks etc. Breakfast was just ok and pretty repetitive/boring, with the only hot item being oatmeal besides coffee/tea. However, the breakfast area is large and amazing; it's on the top floor with all-glass walls and a gorgeous ocean view. Our room came with a fridge and a microwave (upon request) which was quite helpful for an extended stay. The front desk staff were courteous and helpful; however room service and housekeeping requests was very slow whenever we called for something. Not sure if this was because we were on the highest floor. Faccio Pizza in the hotel has great italian food; we tried the pasta dishes one night and they also have great pizzas which seemed popular. The Isla Verde area seemed ok during the day but cops were pretty prevalent on isle verde avenue at night. It seemed safe but it just made us wonder if it was safe to walk the streets esp. at night. Condado seemed like a more happening area to stay in, based on our exploration of resort areas around San Juan. However, this was a reasonable hotel at a convenient location by the beach, and just right for a short vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location OR service!”
Reviews.Author: NortheastPAKittyKat
Reviews.Content: My daughter (19), her two friends and I took advantage of winter break to GET AWAY to San Juan. FIRST OF ALL, if you stay at Wyndham hotels (DAYS INN, HOJOS) on a regular basis please take advantage of the Wyndham points. We used our for a basically FREE STAY this time. Just sign up to take part in Wyndham rewards; they add up QUICKLY!! Definitely not five star, but we didn't go to hang out in our room. Everything was clean, the staff was beyond helpful and friendly, and the beach is steps away. There are plenty of inexpensive (and fun!!) bars and restaurants within walking distance, so you can't beat that either. The Faccio Italian restaurant right in the lobby was great, very reasonably priced, and super convenient if you just want a quick bite during a "beach break". We LOVED the calzone!! All in all, we will DEFINITELY stay there again. Met all of our needs and then some!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Large Group Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mikey S
Reviews.Content: As a softball league, we travel to Puerto Rico from Chicago every year in November and we always stay at this Howard Johnson. It is a group of about 50 and it is the perfect hotel for our needs. They are always very friendly to us and cater to our wishes. The location is excellent, as you are on the Isla Verde strip and it's about a 5 minute walk to get to the end of the strip. They have a nice little pool and the Restaurant in the lobby, Faccio Pizza, will take drinks to you if you desire. Also, as a bonus, Los Pinos Bar and Grill is right next door and is open 24 hours. The value is excellent and thus the reason we have been using the HoJo for the last 10 years. Mikey Sanchez

Reviews.Title: “Great deal across the street from the beach”
Reviews.Author: SeaBass
Reviews.Content: Great as promised for two nights in November. I had a refurbished room with small balcony on 8th floor, water view. Flat screen tv, comfy bed, good desk, refrig, large safe that easily holds a laptop & more, bathroom small but fully functional and clean. Breakfast is simple, fine, and included. Also tried Faccio Pizza on the lobby level, enjoying a huge calzone to go. Pool off the reception area is fine for a quick dip or relaxing to read a book, but with the nice stretch of beach so close, I chose the beach between rain storms. The Beach Club resort has chairs for use if you order something from their bar/restaurant. It's not open for lunch midweek, so I just borrowed a chair & put it back when done after an hour. Also ate good mofongo with chicken at the Ruben's, Cuban joint next door. They share the HoJo parking lot. Clean, good, inexpensive. Definitely walk down to the Metropole restaurant for the best stuffed cornish hen. It's about a 12 minute easy walk to the right from the hotel, after the cockfight arena (supplier of the cornish hens???). Same staff there for at least 20 years. Place was full at 2pm with local business people. So it must be the place of choice. Cross the street from there to the Ritz Carlton to see the other half of Isla Verde beach. Very nice. Walgreens is a 3 minute walk to the right to get a 12-pack of beer or some rum! Makes for good relaxing on the beach. And check out the El San Juan lobby bar from 9-12 most nights for good live salsa music. Interesting people watching there, too. Casino is moderate size, but really grumpy dealers & staff. Only thing I felt was a little rip was the taxi to/from hotel. They charge $10 plus $1.50 fuel surcharge each way...and it's a 2 minute ride. Hmmm... Adios, SeaBass

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but...”
Reviews.Author: Croatia_ZG
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Howard Johnson for a week with my friends last month. On th arrival it was slight longish, as check in procedure took a really long time. In fact, i think this was the longest hotel check in i ever had. We had a large room that had a big bed, so it was pretty comfy. Tv functioned ok with good choice of programmes, room was cleand & cleaned every day. Bathroom was little bit sloppy, but still ok. It was clean, but it kind of, needs some refreshment.... Breakfast we had was ok only for first day, already second day you don't know what to take because there is literally only few things displayed... A toast, jelly, butter, some cereals, 3 types of fruit, coffee, milk and juice... Not quite good, isn't it? And thing that really bothered me was the fact that 2 girls "working" there ate sandwiches with ham and chese during breakfast time, while guests had their empty toasts. Jummy..... Pool area was not too attractive, right next to reception, everyone on the reception can see you plus there are always some locals swimming, which we didnt like too much. Hotel location was good, close to airport (but far enough), bars, shops and beach which we used few times... Parking in the hotel is not free, but as special guest you have a special price, which was fair. Old SJU is some 15 minutes away (by car), which is ok. If you need/ some evening walks, disregard some previous comments about security in hotel's area, cause it is actually very safe. On the other hand, if you act unsafe, there isn't a place on the earth which is safe enough for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: worldbell
Reviews.Content: The rooms and decor are standard fare for a Howard Johnson. There is a small courtyard and pool, which is nice. The beautiful beach is right across the street, very convenient! The restaurant and bar on the top floor are a great place to relax and has a nice view. The bartender was the friendliest person we met in San Juan and was very patient with our Spanish. Overall, the location and price make this comfortable, if a bit modest, hotel a good value!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Spotty1235
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in this well located hotel October 14 and 15. We had a very comfortable room with an ocean view. Restuarants are very close by. The included breakfast was good and most pleasant of all were the two front desk attendants Eymar and Noelia who were working that weekend. Their positive attitude and helpfulness made our stay that much nicer. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Gilbert G
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Puerto Rico, and I have stayed at the Howard Johnson hotel many times over the past two years. The hotel is conveniently located, not far from the airport, and you just cross the street to access the path to the beach. The rooms are clean and well maintained. Also, the staff is very courteous. In fact, they make an effort to address me by name. I think that this hotel is an excellent value for the price, which includes a continental breakfast. The Italian restaurant on the lobby level serves very good, moderately-priced lunches and dinners. There is also a nice swimming pool in the back along with a fitness center with a treadmill, exercise bike, and other equipment. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Miguel c
Reviews.Content: Let me make it simple. I have teaveled and been in so called 5 star hotels, however, my stay at the HoJo in Isla Verde has been 100% satisfactory. I could have stayed at a high end hotel BUT WHY SPEND MY MONEY FOOLISHLY! The staff and management have proven to be 5 stars, truly a wonderful experience. The money I saved allowed me to enjoy all the amenities the area has to offer. 0 out of 0 people found this review helpful.Was this review helpful? Yes - No- Flag as inappropriate

Reviews.Title: “Like Family”
Reviews.Author: Castro_R
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times. The one thing that always is a true constant, is that no matter what request I have made of the staff at this hotel they have always helped me as if it was a request made to them by a family member. Help with directions, booking a room on short notice, holding a shipment for me before I arrive on the island. I could mention many more things, but the truth is that I would be repeating a lot of the same positive things that some of these other customers having been saying on their reviews. I hope you enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: Lupe M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business as well as pleasure. I found the hotel to be in an excellent location, close to the airport and restaurants as well as major outlets. The hotel was very clean and the staff super friendly and very helpful. I found the accomodation very comfortable, clean and spacious. I have recommended this hotel to my clients and colleagues as well for any of their future stay. I will definitely be returning to this hotel on any future business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Sweet_PR_QTee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night before my cruise and I would stay here again. We arrived early and were able to check in. Noelia and Maribel were very helpful in answering any questions I had. My room was big and spacious and had a cute little sitting area. My son loved the pool most. It's right next to a burger king and other other eateries. You didn't even have to leave the building if you got hungry. Walgreens is a short 2 blocks away and it's open 24 hours, the bus stop was right across the street and can take you to condado and old san juan for just 75 cents. The beach was directly across the street. I got a nice low rate and great service from this hotel. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a nice hotel in a convenient location in Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly and very helpful,i will be back”
Reviews.Author: art965
Reviews.Content: maribel is very helpful,she goes above and beyond to make sure that everything is good,she is always smilling when i see her,very polite and understanding,i do alot of traveling and stay in driffrent hotel they could learn alot from her,the whole staff is very helpful and that makes me feel good,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RainaboBaina
Reviews.Content: Great location near the beach, great restaurants and nightlife. I'll definitely be back to earn more wyndam frequent visitor points!

Reviews.Title: “Noelia is the reason why you want to stay here”
Reviews.Author: deb_sonoma_CA
Reviews.Content: She is the lady who works at the front desk. Very gracious, kind, professional, and resourceful!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Lee t
Reviews.Content: First room they gave me I got felt like a room from a horror movie! Dirty and dark! I asked to be moved they said hotel was booked but trust me the place was empty! They did give me another room but they had attitude in doing so. Internet was HORRIBLE!! SLOW and dropped my connection. Do NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, walking distance from the beach and clean room”
Reviews.Author: albert407
Reviews.Content: I was reading some of the reviews and I can not believe that some people find this place not clean. I had use this hotel at least four times in last two years and every time the rooms are very clean and with some partial view of the Isla Verde beach or the city. Pool area is very nice, as the pizza restaurant in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Arandela
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 14 adults coming to a a two-week educational experience in Puerto Rico. We stay there every other year. Hotel is very well located and that makes it very attractive. The lobby is nice and the restaurant in the hotel is a convenience. The pool area was enjoyable. However maintenance of the rooms was poor. Many rooms have been updated but others have not. here was a roach in one room and the guests in that room had to be relocated. Bathrooms in some rooms were not well cleaned. In one room the dust was hanging from the bathroom fan and in another there was a plumbing damage that took four days to be addressed. We had to go to a different room to take showers because after all previous problems with our stay and finally getting adecent room, we refused to be moved to a different room. We wanted the administration to solve the problem and not penalize us for a problem that was their responsibility. In some rooms the air conditioning could not be controlled (thermostat was not working) so people were freezing. In many rooms the bathrooms are very small and uncomfortable. People in the front desk were nice.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel bad local”
Reviews.Author: disgruntledpowkr
Reviews.Content: For being across the street from one of the most beautiful beaches in Puerto Rico, the area was run down with smelly garbage in the streets, And cheesy bars and even a condom store, If you stay here stick to the hotel and beach. The front desk was just there for checking in, not very helpful, didn't even have stamps. One bright point, the pizzeria/bar attached to the hotel was fantastic. Has free internet, but NOT secure and not 'high speed'

Reviews.Title: “Convenient San Juan lodging”
Reviews.Author: EndofRoad
Reviews.Content: Ten dollar taxi ride from SJU. Quick efficient front desk staff. Very nice continental breakfast served on 10th floor... muffins, toast with jams, various cereals, fruits, juices, coffee and milk. Clean comfortable rooms. I stayed two nights, different rooms. The higher up you stay, the less road noise. Pool looked nice. Within three minute walk of several simple resturants, Walgreens, Allied car rental and Charlies car rental. Less than 6 minutes to a nice 24hr grocery store. Great "base camp" for exploring San Juan. They do charge for parking however.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay, good location to the beach.”
Reviews.Author: time_in_the_sun1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed here both pre and post cruise. Arrived on a Friday (Jan 28), checked out on Sunday, then a week later checked in for 1 day (Feb 6). Had room with double beds both times. As mentioned by pretty much everyone, the bathroom is small. Very small. But I never had a problem with water temperature, volume or anything. The beds and room were cleaned adequately and the people were nice. The free breakfast in the morning is a fine cold breakfast type. The restaurant is up on the 10th floor so the views are great. The hotel is a 10 cab ride (plus 1 dollar per bag) from the airport and 20 to the pier. The hotel is right across the road (and a 50 foot path) from the beach which was a mandatory thing for us. We are beach people and were at the beach as quickly as we could. The beach there (isla verde) is a great beach. No vendors pushing you stuff. Nice water for playing in (good for body surfing and kite boarding, but surfing ). The sand is great for the kids to build castles in and easy on the feet. It is also cleaned daily. The hotel is conviently located on a strip with lots to eat. If you are able.. when checking in, book a room on the 5th floor. The 5th floor rooms have balconies. The corners (room 512) has a balcony that is easily 3 times the size of the room itself. There are lounge chairs and everything already there. If you are there for a couple of days, I would for sure try to get one of these rooms. The AC worked fine. The only negatives I would say would be the slow elevator (we ended up using the stairs going up and down, the small bathrooms, and the smell of cig smoke that came in through the bathroom vent. I would for sure recommend this as a pre and post cruise hotel. Oh, the free wi-fi did work but was not constant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fl0rida_Beach_L0ver
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for a long time, since it was a Travel Lodge, the best thing about it is their location, across the street from one of the best stretches of Isla Verde beach. Other fancier and more expensive hotels such as El San Juan Towers do not have such as nice beach area, as lately a lot of seaweeds seen to wash off in from of them. The Howard Johnson hotel has a very friendly staff, just make sure you dont get booked into one of the claustrophobic rooms in the ground level, without windows. Now they dont charge you for parking, which is really nice. The place is ideal to go to and from the Airport, Old San Juan, Condado etc and the area is not as traffic congested as Condado. Dont leave without trying the Alto Grande coffee in the room. It is an amazingly good coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Alden154943
Reviews.Content: Overall we were satisfied with our stay for the price but with a few draw backs. We stayed 5 nights in the hotel on the fourth floor. Room was very spacious but the bathroom was tiny. Not sure why they couldn't have dedicated a little more space to the bathrooms. The lobby was nice enough, the staff there very friendly and helpful. Elevators are very flaky. From the fourth floor, trying to call the elevator was difficult. If the elevator was on a higher floor, the elevator would only descend to the fifth floor and get stuck. If you wanted to get to the fourth floor from the upper floor, it would stop at the fifth floor. You'd have to press 5 to open the doors, then press 4 to start moving again. Weird. The service elevator was the next option but it was also very slow. Wi-fi worked for the first couple of days and then didn't work the rest of our time there unless you went to the lobby. The breakfast experience is one that I wish never to repeat. The food was what you'd expect from a cheap continental breakfast, so no surprises there. The tables all had crumbs on them, some had plates and dishes left on them. We ate there on our first morning and last morning. The last morning a lady working there named Lily was extremely rude and in a loud, condescending and almost shouting tone, instructed everybody that they were responsible for cleaning there own tables (previous diners there had not done so). She said that we were responsible for cleaning our own tables so that they could continue to bring out the food. This was in a very demeaning tone. Quite shocking really. Especially considering everybody in there was still eating and any previous culprits that had not cleaned their own tables were not there so could not be on the receiving end of that rant. It wasn't that she was just having a bad day either, because on the first morning we ate breakfast there, we observed her belittling her subordinates in front of the guests. Not sure how anyone with an attitude like that could retain a job in customer service in this economy.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carla B
Reviews.Content: Every year, my family and I visit San Juan in early December. We've been staying in this hotel since it was originally Travelodge. The staff are always very friendly and speak very good English. This hotel is close to many restaurants (there is a Burger King next door!), stores, apartment buildings, and there is a large 24/7 Grande supermarket down the road, about ten minutes walk. Many buses pass here, and frequently too, so you don't always have to use a taxi. There is a pool. The hotel gives you passes for breakfast upstairs in their restaurant which is Italian themed - you're allowed a muffin or croissant, juice or coffee. There is a lot of really amazing artwork up there. I would recommend this to anybody. I LOVE this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A bit above the average at the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: beeci
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just at the perfect location: the beach is just 50 metres away, you can see it from the balcony, and in the avenue where the hotel is situated, you can find anything you need. Nothing special about the service and rooms, but it's worth to mention that WiFi is really working in the rooms and is really free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “I want to repeat the trip again.”
Reviews.Author: 8797MESIAS
Reviews.Content: Mayra front desk customer service make the diference with an excellent service. The rate offers and the great personal attention to us , was the reason to make the decision to stay and decided to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back! Absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: reds9
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews we decided to go with the majority and booked for 2 nights pre-cruise. I had second thoughts after re-reading some of the bad reviews but had non-refundable reservation so we went through with it. First impression was a nice, clean and nicely decorated lobby. Front desk staff could not have been more helpful. The rooms were spacious and clean and judging from some of the reviews we must have been in an upgraded room as the furniture was nice. The bathroom was a little small but certainly adequate. What I liked was the windows actually opened. I'm not a fan of the cold even though I live in Pa we vacation where it is warm. To open the windows and let in the ocean air was a definite plus. Ok it might be a stretch that it is ocean air since the hotel sits on a main road but there was definitely a breeze. The road was a little noisy but we didn't notice any excess noise nor have trouble sleeping at night although we did close the windows. The beach is a very short walk across the highway and through a walkway. The breakfast vouchers covered the minimum but we splurged an extra $7 and I got the full breakfast which was too much to eat so I heated it the following day. The walgreens a few blocks away is very convenient, Burger King is right next door if you want fast food. The pool area was nice and clean. I just can't say anything bad about howard johnson, Carolina.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected layover”
Reviews.Author: TripTik23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were put up here for a night when American Airlines botched our connection from St. Croix to New York. We found the hotel clean and serviceable with good wi-fi connection. Due the the brevity of our stay, we were unable to explore much of the surrounding area, although I understand the beach is just a stone's throw away. A 24-hour Walgreen's is only two blocks away so you can stock your in-room fridge with plenty of supplies. The pizza parlor in the lobby isn't any great shakes, but it was late and we were tired so a grande pepperoni pizza was just fine. Check-out was a breeze and taxis are available around the clock if you need to get to the airport at an odd hour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clarakoser
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The furniture is from the 1960s which is all right with me. For us smokers, we have the second floor reserved which is a must and a plus. There is wi-fi in the rooms as advertised. The pizzeria/italian restaurant in the lobby is great and the pizza is the best. There is a parking lot next door - cheap. You will pay the hotel for it when you register. Cristina from the hotel was very accommodating as I asked to be moved to another room and it was done at once. Will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NoGo HoJo!”
Reviews.Author: Lifesabrook
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel through an Elderhostel (Exploritas) tour, and could hardly believe how shabby and run down it was. Start with the wastebaskets in the lobby under leaks in the ceiling. Or the sawn off window handles in the rooms. The air conditioning has one setting -- freezing (even when set to 90 degrees.) Both elevators (one a service elevator) don't distinguish between "up" and "down." The guest room showed years of grime: stained, sticky carpets, a scarred, dented refrigerator, moldy shower curtain, holes in the plaster, drip marks on the door, etc. (Apparently a few rooms have been refurbished, but not many.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LPHDenmark
Reviews.Content: Hojo has the most friendly and helpful staff. They were always ready to help and give us good advice on what to see, where to eat and anything else we could think of asking. The room was what we paid for, 2 beds and a baths. No balcony, but we could se the beatch out of the quite dirty windoes. The breakfast was sad. Two angry ladies serving cold toast, coffe and juice (very restricted). We can recommend a warm muffin though, they were quite good! But the view from the 10th floor was spectacular! We rented a car from Charlie down the road and logistically Hojo is perfectly located.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: lovetovacation99
Reviews.Content: Was offered free continental breakfast when I booked. Was not told that even though our party included four people ( 2 adults and 2 children) the free breakfast was for only 2 people. When we went for breakfast, we found out it consisted of one muffin, one orange juice and one coffee. A second cup of coffee or muffin was extra. Also the hotel does not have washers or dryers. The room was so small the second bed almost blocked the entrance to the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good for a economical hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfever24
Reviews.Content: When I first started to look for vacation prices, I was looking at a more or less of a budgeted vacation. I really wanted to stay at these four or five star hotels, but it wasnt in my budget. I probably had the money for it at the time but then I would not have enough spending money for this trip. I rather have more spending money for the trip than to spend the extra money for a hotel room that I'm only going to be sleeping in for few hours. So, this hotel caught my eye even though it had mix reviews. At first, I was feeling that it was not my first choice. Then, I re read the reviews over and over and re read other hotel reviews as well. I decided to go with this hotel. I am so glad that I chose this hotel. When I first arrived at the hotel, I was already expecting a dark dungeon with roaches and other bugs welcoming my arrival. Actually, the room was slightly small but very clean. It had two double beds that were hard as a rock when you first lay on it. It was so hard that you can spin on your head like your breakdancing on cement. When I slept on the bed, it felt comfortable. I dont know if my spouse and I were so tired because of lack of sleep from partying late every night. The beds didnt feel so bad after all. The bathroom was kind of small but i dont mind it anyways. I like my bathroom time as private time. They have a way better showerhead than the one I have in my house. You can switch it to different modes like massage, rain shower, and other functions which i have no idea what they are for. It like your garden hose with that multifunction head like horizonal and vertical. Our room had a small fridge, microwave and coffeemaker. It was convienent especially it you have leftovers from takeouts. You can always reheat it and enjoy just like it was brought to you from the restaurant. The coffee they offer is sooo easy to make and so delicious. The only thing is that you have quite a distance to a supermarket. You can go to walgreens or a small c-store accross the street from walgreens to get some microwavable food. I did have a partial ocean view which I didnt care for. The best part of it is that the hotel is right accross the street from the beach. Its a small walkway. You can miss it if you dont look right. The enterance is right accross the street from hotel.There is a pool but I never utilized it cause THE BEACH IS ACCROSS THE STREET... WALKING DISTANCE!! So take advantage! Plus go the beach at night. its not dangerous like i thought it was. It was romantic and relaxing. Dont worry you will see other couples as well.There is construction going on the streets. Dont worry about noise. They dont work weekends and looks like they only work only a few hours a day. Just becareful and watch your step when you are walking down the isla verde avenue. The streets are undone and you can fall or trip. I received free continintal breakfast vouchers but I never used them. I rather eat the traditional puerto rican food. There is a restaurant next door from hotel called Los Pinos. It looks ugly and dirty but it is sooo good and inexpensive. The average plate is about $8 to $15. The sandwiches averaged $5 to $7. The alcoholic drinks averaged $2 to $4.It was worth it. If you wanna inexpensive alcoholic drinks. Go to local bars outside of hotels. Overall, this trip experience was great. It was not a let down. The hotel was worth the money. I had no problems with the employees or room. Great customer service. If you need to ask advice about puerto rico of what or where to go, ask the front desk. They are good with that kind of stuff. To the reader, I wish you well on your decision and have fun on the trip. I had a unforgettable experience with puerto rico in which i would re live the moment any time. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TJbaby
Reviews.Content: Affordable, spotless and friendly staff! What more could you ask for? The free continental breakfast was just a muffin and juice but that was the only downside to the hotel. There are plenty affordable places to eat in very near walking distance and the area is great! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money and location, very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: irishmist1
Reviews.Content: I booked one night online via their website and got a very good AAA rate of $136 that included taxes and fees (for a tiny room without windows). When I got there I was offered a room upgrade for only $11 more, so took the option. I ended up with an ocean view room for a rate considerably lower than anything else in the area, and this also came with a (very limited) continental breakfast and free wireless Internet. The staff was very friendly and helpful in suiggesting something to do on the one day I had there alone. They also permitted me to have a late check-out by 2 hours. Nothing luxurious, but the hotel is clean and comfortable and fit what I was looking for for one night. One drawback is the noisy construction going on outside, but not a big deal. A very good value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Extravagant About Howard Johnson in San Juan/Carolina”
Reviews.Author: Tarnwood
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only ten minutes or so from the airport, so we stayed there on the last night of our trip to Puerto Rico so we could have an easy trip to return the rental car and catch our flight out the next day. On the pro side, this hotel is close to the airport and close to the public beach, which has a sidewalk which grants access about 4 or 5 blocks away. The beach is very nice and clean. It was also very easy to pick up a taxi to take us to Old San Juan rather than trying to fight the mid-day traffic. The cost of the taxi was $19-20 for two people. I don't know if it would cost more or less if there were different numbere of people being transported. The cab drivers were very nice. One went out of his way to point out the trolley stands and emphasized it was a free way to get around the old city. On the con side, this hotel has seen better days. The room we stayed in on the 3rd floor was worn. Our bathroom was very tiny and the tub, which had been previously retrofitted, had the layer that recovered the bottom of the tub peeling off. A rubber mat had been cemented to the bottom of the tub! The free continental breakfast was only juice, coffee and some toast or a croissant. We had decent tasting crepes for only $8.00. The pool closed at 7:00 p.m., so we never had a chance to use it. To be fair, almost everything seems to close early in Puerto Rico. While this place was not terrible, this will not be my first choice when planning a return trip to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tamita99
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price I paid. The service was excelent. The only thing that I didn't like and I was very angry about was the suppose "Free Continental Breakfast" . You have to go to the restaurant and they only give coffee or orange juice and a toast and that's it. If you want a omelet or something like that the prices are way up to high. I recommend to eat breakfast in the Ponderosa Restaurant that is very close to the hotel, about a 5 minute walk. The hotel is very close to the beach, just crossing the street. The location is great because is in the heart of Isla Verde. You can go to others hotels, pubs etc... also the pool is nice. They have a Restaurant called Fascio Pizza.....excelent! Don't eat in the one where is the "free continental breakfast"...is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Safe & Sound Vacation”
Reviews.Author: leite_family
Reviews.Content: Isla Verde - Booking this Hotel was very convenient and affordable on the Howard Johnson Hotel- Carolina website or call [--], (car rental, ext. 2017). (There are promotions going on over the summer so check it out.) The Hotel staff were all very, very helpful at meeting our every need. Although there are hotels across the street, we still have views of the ocean and from the 10th floor restaurant "Fontana di Roma" you have a beautiful view of the turquoise waters and the city. Do not miss this Italian Bistro with excellent breakfast and dinner. The owner "Carlo Picchetti" pulls out all the stops to ensure that you (& your loved ones) have a wonderful dining experience. My daughter celebrated her birthday while on vacation and Fontana di Roma provided us succulent meals (I had the osso bucco) on lovely china and the waiters were very attentive. After the meal a chocolate mousse cake with strawberries was brought out and the waiters sang Happy Birthday (opera style). This experience will remain a treasure for us all. The Hotel is right across the street from a walkway to Isla Verde Beach (just 5 minutes to San Juan). Nicolas at the AAA Allied Car Rental Service in the Hotel was very fast, easy and convenient. Overall our trip has been a wonderful one to remember. The maps provided helped us travel all over the island (gas is just $1.01USD) while coming back to our "Home away from home". I highly recommend this hotel. -RLeite & family

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBE
Reviews.Content: Good pool area and good location being very close to the beach (nice beach but not the best for swimming due to force of waves coming in). Also convenient to get the bus into Puerto Rico - runs from outside the hotel approx. every 25 minutes, costs 75 cents and takes about 35 minutes. What we didn't like so much was the bedroom and bathroom - definitey basic, smell of mildew and needing re-furbishment depending on how much you pay and your expectation. So OK for the one night we stayed post cruise but we wouldn't have wanted to stay for longer.

Reviews.Title: “HOJO = Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: jblaze1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a bachelor party and had 2 rooms for 6 guys. + It was cheap (~$150 a night) and did not require a pre-pay (meaning that it was cancelable) The receptionist was nice and answered questions well. The location is great in the Isla Verde area Parking is cheap, if you rent a car - The floors were kind of damp all of the time One of the bedroom windows did not open One bathroom smelled like mildew There is no safe in the room (although there is one at the front desk) The pool is not nice (not bad, but not fun to hang out at and no view of anything but a fence) Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for post or pre-cruise vacation”
Reviews.Author: CANUCKSCRUISING
Reviews.Content: HAMILTON, ONTARIO CANADA FEBRUARY, 2008 We stayed at his hotel as a pre-cruise destination. Arrived at the hotel at 4:00 p.m. It is a very short drive from the Airport. Check in was a breeze. Rooms are clean and include iron, coffee maker, fridge, and microwave. Bathroom is tiny but clean and renovated. Airconditioning worked well noise level was quiet all night. There is a restaurant in the main lobby selling mostly Italian Food. Food is not bad and reaonably priced. We took the bus to Old San Juan. 75 cents per person and about a 15 minute drive. The bus ride was an eye opener as we drove through what looked like a lot of government housing. Wouldn't recommend doing this at night. Took a taxi back from Old San Juan at the end of the night cost was 19.00 dollars. This was a more than acceptable hotel for a very reasonably priced will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's A Hotel, No Mas”
Reviews.Author: Quailrancher
Reviews.Content: The Carolina HoJo is an extremely adequate place to stay, if you know what I mean. The price is right, the room is standard, and the location is convenient. Five minutes from the airport and convenient to San Juan without the intown hassles. The street, Isla Verde, is busy and you should avoid rooms with a view of the water. With the view you also get passing traffic that includes boombox-loud cars at all hours. The view is not worth it even 6 stories up. Plus, there is a highrise condo directly across the street, so the view is obstructed anyway. Dining here is quite good, although there are a lot of decent places to eat in the area, so you don't have to dine in. Desk service was excellent, but note that all phone calls carry an extra charge. While we were there only one elevator was working. No way to tell whether that is common, but at best there are only two elevators for a 9 story hotel. Barely enough, and not enough when it's busy. Sound deadening between rooms was fine, and we noted no hall noise in the room. Don't drink out of the glass tumblers unless you personally see them brought in by the maid. They are probably wiped and reused. There is a mini-fridge that works and a better than decent TV. The desk staff doesn't know it, and the printed chanel list doesn't show it, but check CH 99 for the cable listings.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: Desire1962
Reviews.Content: Okay, for basic accommodations. The pool was nice and it was close to everything. Parking is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time, Not So Fine”
Reviews.Author: BFRMaryland
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place. We made the mistake of staying here a second time thinking it may have improved. Wrong! It was worse than our first stay. It took 5 calls to the front desk to get a roll-away bed that was already supposed to be in the room. The beds - horribly uncomfortable. Sheets - like paper towels. Service - beyond rude. The restaurant was worse than our room. We waited almost an hour for our tasteless breakfast. We ended up serving ourselves coffee. Please do not let this review taint the Howard Johnson in Old San Juan, which we found to be very nice and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “The Howard Johnson in Isla Verde was OK...”
Reviews.Author: yessy
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at this hotel. This time my room smelled old and musky, the bathroom was small and you have to pay $7.oo dollars for parking per day. Overall the hotel is OK! It is located across the street from some private apartment building but there is a small pathway that is open to the public so you can go to the beach. The big expensive hotels are within minutes by car. Will not recomend to walk too late at night there is a Irish pub / niteclub that plays hip hop that is not considered safe by the locals even though it is always full and has long lines to get in so it is better to drive, park inside the nicer hotels. DO not do valet the casinos would not over it. This hotel (HJ) is very close to the airport (about 5 minutes drive) but you will still need to be at the airport atleast 3 hours before the flight because even though the natives/locals are extremely nice - the ones at the airport are not. They are disorganized and slow. Make sure you check your bags through the agriculture machine before you even do the line to check in with your airline. Overall, the hotel is Ok for the price compare to the others around that area.

Reviews.Title: “Run-down HoJo”
Reviews.Author: hardychica
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HoJo for one night because we needed a hotel close to the airport. I figured that HoJo would be a safe bet because it's a chain which I thought would have consistent standards of cleanliness. I was wrong. First off, when we arrived at the hotel on Saturday evening, there was one man working the front desk and phones. Four people were waiting in line to check in and it took him a good 45 minutes to get through that group of people. The whole time he's answering phones and trying to check people in, his manager is just standing there watching him instead of jumping in and helping. When we finally got our keys the hotel elevators took FOREVER. I mean it was crazy how long you would wait to get into one of those death traps. Unfortunately, the room didn't get much better than that. The hotel is definitely a late 70's/early 80's building that is desperate need of a renovation. I can tolerate ugly decor, but the rooms just were dirty. There were major rust stains all in the shower, the carpet was dirty and it just looked like a lot of band-aid repairs were done to fix problems. Like if you looked at the corners of the bathtubs and sinks you could see large chunks of miscolored caulking added to fix problems. Also, the bathroom was really dark with this one spooky flourescent light that made you feel like you were in the Bates motel. Breakfast wasn't much better. They give you complimentary continental breakfast coupons when you check in. You eat on the top level of the hotel where I thought there would just be a little buffet table with some danishes and milk. But, you sit down, restaurant style and are given a breakfast menu. Just remember that this is not included in the free continental breakfast. Those meals cost more, however you can use your free vouchers for $2 off one of those other breakfast entrees. In the end, one night was more than enough for me at the HoJo. I'm sure if you're partying and want a cheaper place to stay across the street from the beach you may not mind. But I expected a lot more for the $170/night charge.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good time.”
Reviews.Author: Jerseyboy27
Reviews.Content: Stayed the weekend of March 17th. The hotel was nice, room was clean - we even got a suite with a huge bathroom. The pool was nice, could use a hot tub but still was enjoyable. It was also nice to have the beach right across the street and the hotel will give you towels. Only negative was the restaurant. It is NOT owned by the Hojo which explains why they have issues. Service is as slow as can be and the food was overpriced. $5.00 for a small glass of juice, come on!!! They only give a $2.50 credit for your breakfast voucher and the inflated prices obviously cover that. Go out for breakfast, don't waste your time up there waiting all morning. If you go to Old San Juan (and I highly recommend you do) do no, I repeat DO NOT go on the bus. Yes, it is 75 cents but the $20 you spend on the cab will be the best $20 you ever spend. We toolk the bus and it was HORRIBLE!!!! They must have packed 100 people on that bus, I was nearly crushed to death and I am not kidding!!! Otherwise, we like the Hojo and the location was good. Only 10 minutes from the airport too - so we would return, but eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Mojo in HoJo”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRican
Reviews.Content: The seventies decor was outdated and drab. The bathrooms were small and dirty (there was someone elseâ€™s hair on the toilet). The desk staff copped an attitude about making the reservation through Expedia. The view of the beach is mostly blocked by another high-rise. The complimentary breakfast was a joke. You're given breakfast vouchers for the upstairs restaurant and it's only worth $2.50 off the meal. That's not even enough for toast and coffee. Yogurt and fruit is $7.00 and omelets are $11.50. I wish we had stayed somewhere else--even if it was more money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But Watch the Location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LADB
Reviews.Content: After reviewing all the info, we called the Hotel directly. Booked for the evening of Feb. 11, 2007. We actually didn't even know there was a location in Old San Juan, but certainly would not have wanted to stay there, as we were on our way out of the city the next day. We had confirmed reservations....yet had to pay almost double! Why? On some websites, the phone number for the Old San Juan location is listed for the Isla Verde Hotel! We called, they had a room, and we didn't know there were 2 locations, so we didn't think to ask! Fortunately this location had a room, but they did not believe that the phone number problem was their mistake, so we had to pay the difference. I'm not sure who has caused the problem, but, even here on TripAdvisor, when you hit the bars for info on the Isla Verde HoJo Hotel, you get info on the Old San Juan Hotel. Room was OK, a bit shabby but as expected. Pool was beautiful. You get a Continental Breakfast, but....if you choose from the menu, you only get $2.00 off your meal. And you then have to pay for your coffee, which would have been part of the free breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service-Howard Johnson-Isle Verde-Carolina PR”
Reviews.Author: shell43
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about the staff at this hotel. They were all wonderful and treated us like gold. Staff made several phone calls for me attempting to set up a fishing charter, called the rental car(Budget)for me, to cancel since they are no longer located at the hotel. Chose 'Charlies car rental' a couple blocks away, instead, cost for 3 days car rental including taxes was 100.00. Night Mgr. Hector Camacho could not have been nicer and has a great crew. The hotel is very clean. The pool was great and never crowded. Located across the street from a gorgeous beach, where chair rentals are 4.00 a day from a gentleman on the beach. Dont understand the complaints about the continental breakfast. You get what you pay for. Included in your stay - Coffee and danish or croissant each morning, or 2.50 toward your breakfast. Restaurant service is slow, yes, but so is everything else in the carribean. We got ours to go, and we were off. Happy hour daily from 6-10pm---3.00 drinks excluding Chevis and Johnnie Walker. Excellent cheap places to eat a few doors down, as well as a Walgreens in walking distance. Charlies car rental a couple blocks away. I would recommend this hotel. It isnt the Marriott, but then again, we werent going to waste our cash on a fancy place ,that we would not be in, but to sleep and shower. Had a rental car for 3 days and we were never charged the parking fee-pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price in Isla Verde area!”
Reviews.Author: Nevr2ez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HoJo, Isla Verde for 5 nights and absolutely loved the stay there. The staff was very courteous and the room was nice and clean. The bathroom was a bit small but we didn't mind. We had a Junior Suite at the HoJo. The seafood restaurant on the lobby level was gorgeous with some delicious meals served. We had some traditional Puerto Rican food at the restaurant. The "free continental breakfast" is not even worth it! All you get there is a Danish or a Crossaint, a cup of coffee and a glass of orange juice. If you decide to order from the menu it is a rip off! You might as well go downstairs to the street level to the Burger King located right next door to the hotel and have a nice breakfast for less! The staff at the front dest were very nice, especially the manager Mr. Ramos, front desk clerks Leslie and Marisol. There is a Budget car rental located right there in the lobby. The girl there, Maria is very helpful as well. The hotel has a reasonably ok swimming pool as well. The junior suite is reasonably big with a refrigerator and a microwave oven. The room is cleaned everyday and towles are replaced everyday. The only slight problem that we noticed was that we could faintly hear the people in the hallway even with the door closed. But this didn't bother us too much. Besides that the stay was nice and comfortable and we would definitely stay at the HoJo if we return to San Juan. The safe deposit is located in the looby area by the front desk. Its a good idea to keep your valuables locked up. The staff at the front desk was very helpful in arranging tours to the rainforest, the beach and the bioluminescence bay. They also gave us proper directions to get to Old San Juan(which is a must see area of San Juan) on public transportation. Public transportaion is available right outside of the hotel. Isla Verde beach is right across the street from the hotel as well. There are pleanty of places to eat and drink on Isla Verde Ave. There is also a Walgreens, a Pizza Hut, an internet cafe and scooter rental within walking distance from the hotel. The only thing we couldn't find on Isla Verde Ave was a coin operated laundromat anywhere nearby. The hotel provides laundry service, then you would have to pay the hotel prices for that. I would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget travelling to San Juan. Its certainly better than some of the cheap motel like hotels across the highway!

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: Dog-man
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while attending a weddking, and for those purposes it was fine. The room was comfortable and though we were on a smoke-free floor, you could smell smoke. One small elevator to serve 9 floors. (Actually, there is an additional down the short service hall to the right of the main elevator. But the staff have tried to turn this into a srvice elevator by putting up "repair" signs, etc. on it. We used it in a pinch, especially at night.) Hotel staff were adequate. Restaurants were slow, even for Puerto Rico standards, but the food was quite good, especially in the 10th floor Italian restaurant -- the view alone is worth the wait!! Took us 30 minutes to get a croissant, coffee, and pre-mixed fuit salad. (One tip: Don't get the complimentary continetal breakfast; instead apply the $2.50 toward a regalar breakfast.) Pool was nice, and beach, across the street was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: Lark47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Howard Johnson in Isla Verde in March 17-20. We were disappointed as soon as we checked in and saw our room. It was on the lobby floor which may not have been terrible except for the fact that the room was tiny, you could hear everything that was happening outside of the room and worst of all, there were no windows! It was a dark little dungeon. But for the fact that we were only staying 3 nights, I was very close to walking down the street and finding something else. We did ask to change rooms but the staff stated that everything was booked. The staff, by the way, could have been a bit more customer service oriented. They seemed to have attitudes and were not receptive to questions. The service in the hotel restaurant was terrible. The waitstaff were friendly but the service was beyond slow. They don't acknowledge you when you walk in, you have to just guess that you should pick any seat available. The tables were still dirty from prior customers and on one occasion, we waited approx. 30 minutes before anyone even came over to take our order. It was so bad that we complained to the restaurant manager and we weren't the only ones complaining. On the good side, the pool was nice and the beach is conveniently right across the street. The hotel is nicely situated on a relatively busy strip but having visited Old San Juan, I would have rather stayed nearer to there because they seemed to have a much wider and nicer selection of restaurants than where we were and our location seemed better suited for spring breakers. The bus stop to Old San Juan is across the street from the hotel and is approx. 45 mins, it costs about 50 cents. El Yunque is a must see and I would recommend renting a car a driving there as it's a relatively easy drive and was much cheaper than a tour. Our one day car rental was $27 and the visitors center at El Yunque charges about $3.

Reviews.Title: “Overall okay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's like any other Howard Johnson. The rooms are bland but comfortable. There's a fridge, tv, and hairdryer in every room. The good: It is cheaper than the other hotels nearby. (Don't stay at the cheap inns that charge you around $90-$110 a night. They look ghastly.) The pool is clean. The rooms are't too small but don't expect a large room. The beach is right across the street. Just walk through a clean, cute alley way and you're at the nicest beach in puerto rico. (luquillo beach was an absolute disgust.) Restaurants, casinos, other hotels within minutes from this hojo. Felt very safe walking along avenide isla verde. Bus right outside that goes to old san juan. its 75 cents, not 25. The bad: Walls are very thin, especially in the bathroom. The windows open very wide. One could easily fall out. The bathroom could use a lot of work. The breakfast consists of coffee, orange juice, croissiants, danishes, and toast. That's it. If you want any eggs, bacon, etc, you have to pay for it. And about the review below mine, there is no 12th floor. Typo, maybe because all the other descriptions are correct.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!! What hotel did the good reviews stay at???”
Reviews.Author: joshua-bwi
Reviews.Content: Just checked in. What a dump!!! Relied upon good reviews here on trip advisor and expected it to be no more than a basic hotel but what we got.... 1. Room smells of cigarettes and mildew. 2. Requested a non-smoking room. None available. Hotel full. Take it or leave it attitude from the front desk. 3. Torn and stained sheets, bed spreads. 4. Bathroom has stainless steel commercial fixtures (toilet paper holder for example) with crud all over it. 5. You can hear (word for word) the conversations of people in the hall or in the other rooms. 6. Room is very small (but this was expected). 7. Rooms on the 2nd floor are interior rooms. The window looks out into the lobby but not to the outside. 8. Staff is NOT FRIENDLY. 9. 1 Elevator is broken. The other is a service elevator and is VERY slow. 10. Carpet not cleaned. 11. We are looking for another hotel so that we can check out of here ASAP!!! 12. Hotel claims they are across the street from the beach... Well.... once you pass through a row of highrises across the street you will find the beach in the distance. You need to walk 2 blocks down the road to get the the beach access path. My advise, stay elsewhere!!! This is just not worth it. The good.... 1. the pool area is cute.

Reviews.Title: “The restaurant was the only good thing about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 510. Our room was very dirty. It had two double beds, one of which you had to climb over to get into the bathroom. The bathroom was very dirty. I was too skeeved to shower because of how nasty the tub looked. I was sure that the place was infested with cockroaches. The carpeting had huge black stains all over it and carpeting was missing in some areas of the room. Closet door was broken. Balcony had garbage all over it-old ciggarette packs and butts etc, and the cement floor had black dirt all over it. My pillow had brown drool stains on it which were visible through the white pillow case and smelled like hundreds of people with morning breath drooled on it for years. The swimming pool was the size of a bathtub. We needed new towels for the other people I was traveling with (who were brave enough to try the shower) and I ordered them at 8:40pm. We kept calling the front desk back because they never came. We went down to the front desk. She said they had no towels. Finally we went to bed, and at 10:20pm a staff person knocked on the door after we were asleep (to catch a 4:10am flight back to NJ), waking us up to give us the towels. We booked a tour of El Yunque and Bacardi Factory through the front desk for 60 dollars each. The tour guide's name was Rafeal. He runs private tours that can be booked through the Howard Johnson. The tour was terrible. He told us we were going to hike the Big Tree and El Yunque trails, and take us to see El Morro and other sites in Old San Juan because we couldn't go to the Bacardi Factory. Well, we didn't hike the trails he promised, we hiked La Mina trails instead. And he didn't give us a tour of anything in Old San Juan, he dropped us off at the ferry in Catano and told us to take the ferry to Old San Juan and have a good time. Then he charged us $65 dollars instead of the $60 we were told when we booked. Lunch was not included. Nothing else was included either- no water, ponchos, sunscreen, bug spray etc, like they are on other cheaper tours. We were really dissatified. I would never do another tour with him. The only good thing I can say about the hotel is the Fontana Di Roma restaurant on the top floor. What a wonderful meal we had there. I was nervous about going to an italian restarant in Puerto Rico, but the food was fabulous and so was the wine. The service was impeccable. They made my meal exactly how I requested it and we didn't have to wait at all for anything that we wanted. The next night, I needed something microwaved and I went up to the restaurant and they did for me with no problem. They were wonderful. The view was so-so, but with food that great, who cares? Also, we were on Isla Verde beach at dusk and we got harrassed by some guys saying sexual things to us. I didn't feel safe in Isla Verde at all. Later at night we walked to a casino in the Embassy Suites about three blocks away and were harrassed again by some disgusting drunk guy on the street. I felt like I was going to get mugged any minute when we were walking there. When we were done playing, we took a cab back to the HOJO instead of walking because it was so dangerous. Would I stay at the Howard Johnson in Isla Verde again? No way. I would go to the restaurant though.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck. You gotta be kidding me...”
Reviews.Author: leahmiz
Reviews.Content: I have never been so disappointed in a hotel, as I am with Howard Johnson's in Old San Juan Puerto Rico. The elevator is broken. The lobby is littered with buckets and caution tape. Rooms, for which you pay $145 per night, are windowless cells with cracked, taped plexiglass over the doorways. Never stay on the 2nd floor unless you like to be woken up every fifteen minutes by the hum and regurgitation of the ice machine next door. I was jolted awake at 6am by only what I can describe as golf balls being tossed down an airshaft. I'm assuming this was the morning wake up call for the ice machine. I requested to be moved, which I was by the helpful, although somewhat clueless staff. It took all day, then they had the problem of giving the room away. Finally, I was given a new room on the fourth floor, with a window, as the internet picture indicated, only to be told that the elevator was inoperable whenever the staff didn't feel like using the elevator key to make it work and accompany me to the fourth floor. The interior lobby is dark, dismal and outdated. The staff is struggling with a sub-par hotel. The rooms are overpriced. The walls and have open wires hanging from them. Stay down the street at Hotel Milano. I wish I did.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some so-so, what did you expect?”
Reviews.Author: Pasqualinho
Reviews.Content: It is a Howard Johnson's in a tropical climate and an expensive area, what did you expect? We paid (AAA) 130 a night (+ $20 taxes). We had room 511. Recommended for types who only want their hotel for bedtime, like being close to the beach and are realistic about the place. The good 1. Five minutes drive to the airport, without the airport sounds (the Courtyard (100$ more a night), Ritz and Hampton Inn (90$ more a night) all border the airport). I am sure the rooms are sound proof, but when you are outside you will hear the jets taking off. 2. Right across from the beach (although there are apartments blocking much of the view). The Hampton Inn (which does have a nicer setting), Embassy and the Holiday Inn are a couple of blocks away. 3. The best part of Isla Verde beach. Maybe the conditions change over time, but that part was nicer than the part the InterC, ESJ Towers and El San Juan front, which are all together (and the beach one would walk to from the Hampton Inn and others). The Courtyard and Ritz (smooth sand, imported?) are on a slightly different beach. The Courtyard is the last building for a long while, which is nice as it abuts a public beach, though there are a few permanent tents there(?). We liked that beach and watched the planes take off as we floated in the water. 4. There is a shower by the pool. On the last day we had a late flight out, so we left our luggage at the desk, returned at 4, swam in the pool (nice area, not big), showered there, got our bags and changed and caught the outrageously expensive taxi for the airport. 5. The window was pretty sound proof, but the hotel is right on top of the main drag so probably a bit noiser than others. The So-so It is an older building and that was the source of the not so good. 1. Old floor tiles (new wall tiles/hair drier/fixtures) and the caulking going. 2. The room itself had the sort of clean but you are in a tropical place feel. A bit dark. 3. We also had noisy young-uns coming in late from partying. 4. It is on the main drag, so you will feel like you are more in a city than at a resort. 5. The room didnt have a safe, but I would recommend leaving valuable at the front desk. 6. In absolute terms, it was not cheap, but relative to the prices of other hotels, it was. Comments on comments others had 1. No problems with wait time on the elevators There are two. 2. Yes, the window would worry me if I had a child. 3. We had the usual amount of coffee in our room and there is a fridge. We didnt even bother trying the continental breakfast. 4. We had a room "with a view" but all of those are partial views. 5. Heard nothing from the pipes.

Reviews.Title: “Small cozy hotel is near everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Howard Johnson in Isla Verde the week or Christmas. Although our flight was 3 hours late, check in was a breeze. They ran out of non smoking rooms which I previously requested so they upgraded us to a suite which was very spacious & clean & didnt smell like smoke at all. Here's the selling point, the beach is literally right across the street from the hotel!!! Isla Verde beach which everyone says is much nicer than the other 2 popular San Juan beaches, Condado Beach & Ocean Park is impeccably clean & gorgeous. Its full of tourists & people who live in the beach front condos. Now for the food. The hotel only serves a croissant & coffee for breakfast so you should walk a few blocks down towards a mini mall that's right across the street from the Intercontinental Hotel to have breakfast at this great little diner where breakfast is delish for like $2.99(including coffee). The hotel beds are very comfortable & the rooms all have satellite TV which pick up all the US channels. The hotel has a small art gallery & 2 restaurants, both way too pricey. Go to the Oyster Bar a couple of blocks down for delicious seafood & even tastier drinks, we loved the Oyster Bar. They have live bands some nights & there's dancing till 4am. For casino lovers, you must visit the Wyndham El San Juan Hotel, the most beautiful casino & lobby area I have ever seen, very swanky so dress your best. And lastly no visit to Puerto Rico is complete without a visit to Old San Juan(a 45 minute bus ride from Isla Verde) with it's cobble stoned streets, art galleries, grand forts & castles, out door cafes & award winning restaurants, it is a must. You can just sit by the cruise ship port & sip on a cup of spanish coffee while taking in the gorgeous sunset. Loved loved loved Old San Juan. All in all the HoJo in San Juan is the Best Value on the strip, inexpensive, cozy & close to everything. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “We weren't dissappointed!”
Reviews.Author: LollyCanuck
Reviews.Content: We chose the HoJo based on lots of research (and the price). We stayed for three nights prior to our cruise. As others have mentioned, the hotel was convenient to the beach, a Walgreens, and several chain restaurants, without the big pricetag. Our room was small but clean, and a big surprise came when I opened the curtains to find a HUGE deck, complete with a couple chairs and a chaise. It had a southern exposure and it was lovely to sit there after a long day of sightseeing. We took the bus downtown, but had to wait nearly an hour, and then it was overcrowded. the only real disappointment was the continental breakfast, which was 1 1/2 pieces of cold toast and a cup of coffee, but it was complimentary.
