Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in the Middle of Everythingl!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, curteous and clean hotel, and conveniently located, too. Old San Juan is just a bus ride away (25 cents) which, you can catch right across the street from the hotel. If you wanna go to the largest and most luxurious shopping mall in the Caribbean, Plaza las Americas, just walk outside the Hotel and catch the bus on the same side of the street!!! The discos and casinos are right there, too. Just ask anyone for directions. Oh, and, a short walk down the street is an internet cafe... $3 for about 20 mts. on the internet! And, a little further down the street, there's a great little restaurant with great food, for about $6 - $10 a meal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price you pay!”
Reviews.Author: Dee78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the HoJo this past week in Isla Verde and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. Reading the reviews here scared me a bit but I decided to stay there anyway. I stayed there for 4 nights and I had a great time. The hotel was clean, the staff was very friendly and gave me pleanty of advice on how to get to different sites (especially the front desk clerk Maribel, she was very helpful). The room was quite comfortable, it had a king size bed, cable TV (which included channels from NYC and other American cities), a refrigerator, hairdryer, iron/ironing board, desk. I stayed on the 8th floor so I did not really here too much noise at night like some of the other guests complained about in these reviews. The pool area was clean and well kept, although the water in the pool was very cold. The fitness was not great at all, it probably had 4 different machines in there (treadmill, bike, and some weights). The hotel was located in a great spot, it was right accross the street from the beach which some of the other hotels are not (like the Embassy Suites, the Hampton Inn & the Holiday Inn). The hotel was also located near a food mall which included some of the common fast food restaurants (BK, Taco Bell, KFC, Pizza Hut) and also a few local restaurants (PR restaurant, Chinese and a Mexican restaurant). I have to say though I was very dissapointed that I did not find too many restaurants serving typical PR food. It was also close to a Walgreen's, two banks, a supermarket and a CyberNet Cafe. The hotel also offers several tours, I took the one for El Yunque and had a great time. I was able to take public transportation to Old San Juan. I took the bus right accross the street from the HoJo, it cost .25 cents and it was about a 45 minute ride. The bus drops you off at the bus terminal in Old San Juan, right accross the street from the Sheraton Hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: The Great South Bay, Long Island, NY
Reviews.Title: “Good for pre night cruise”
Reviews.Author: liz1992
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night pre cruise, January. The location was good to get to the cruise port and the price was right. $105.00. 10 minute ride from airport and cruiseport. Check in was quick. No frills hotel. Lobby okay. Coffee in room, frig, hairdryer, iron if needed, ice machine on all floors. I wouldn't recommend more than 1 night here, no way. Could be alot cleaner, but was acceptable. I like spic and span clean. Rooms were just so. Alot of noise heard thru the windows at night as there is a Burger King on the opposite street with a drive thru. The pool area was nice. Restaurant on premises. (looked okay)There's a 7-11 type store next door for drinks & snacks. There is a great oceanfront bar directly across the street. My recommendation is stay her 1 night pre cruise only, check in and then go out across the street for a cocktail or two, walk on the beach, walk into town to one of the best PR restaurants in the strip mall about 10 blocks to the right upon hotel exit. Retire early after a satisfying meal to rest up for the cruise. Check out around 10:30 am and head for the cruise port. Notes: You can see the Water Club hotel when walkiing at night, look for the blue lights. Last chance to get spirits for the cruise is at the cruise port across the street and to the left from Royal Caribbean within the cruiseport complex, Ask the taxi driver. It's easier to pack your bottles in luggage and bring onboard then it is to buy in the ports.

Reviews.Title: “Stay 1/30, Then 2/11 to 2/13”
Reviews.Author: ekar
Reviews.Content: Our stay on 1/30 was prior to our cruise, and uneventful. The room was satisfactory, but small. The supposed Continental Breakfast was totally unimpressive, and almost nonexistant by 9AM. But all in all...ok for the money of $106, which they charged although they had $105 shown on the website. MAJOR problem upon our return on 2/11, post cruise. We were told they did NOT guarantee the ocean view room as our ON LINE reservation indicated. Luckily, I had a copy of our reservation, and I demanded what they had offered on the website. I then demanded a suite if they couldn't supply what they had guaranteed. The desk clerk indicated, "Suites didn't not have ocean views." A LIE! As I continued to demand a suite for the same price of $106, they finally conceded, and we were given a suite... WITH FULL OCEAN VIEW! Suggestion: Fight for what is RIGHT! Suggestion: SAVE YOUR COPY OF YOUR RESERVATION! Additionally, keep an eye on your credit card posting. It took them over 2 weeks to remove the posting after having paid our bill in cash upon checking out. Would I stay there again: Yes, but I sure would save EVERY COPY of EVERY transaction from the start. Be ready to FIGHT if you have to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: bobgnc
Reviews.Content: Stay Jan 23-27, 2005 For the price of $105 per night this hotel offers a tremendous bargain. It is similar to the Fairfield Inns on the mainland but a bit more upscale. Clean but smallish rooms and bathrooms. Outdoor pool is extremely private but small with no jacuzzi. One of my customers from the area said the Italian restaurant on the 10th floor is his favorite on the Island. The $20-$30 entree fees are typical for this area. There is plenty of fast food nearby for those looking to scrimp. The internet cafe (35 minutes for $5) was less than 5 minutes away. Several nice casinos are no more than 10 minutes walk. If you want a plush pool next to the ocean stay at the Marriot Courtyard but expect to pay $235 per night this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for price-Economic but need upgrades”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is cheap in all aspects, but if you are in business or short stayis good for the money, it is right across beach and close by all type of restaurants, airport just a couple miles. You should expect what you pay for, is clean, but should have some upgrades, it was just fine for my business stay, no business center (computer access), but one close by. Not recommended for vacationers, because your expectations are higher, unless you are in the budget, I paid $100 plus tax plus service charge total $140). Very nice and secluded empty beaches if you take the coast road HWY 187 going East.

Reviews.Title: “Good if money's tight”
Reviews.Author: BYOfood
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the San Juan Howard Johnson hotel during the week following Christmas (2004). We booked our room after a lot of research with other travelers, in books, and online. Our basic requirements were safety, cleanliness, affordability (<$150/night), beach access, and a pool. Here's how it stacked up: 1) Safety - I felt very safe at all times inside of the hotel, though I wouldn't recommend a woman wandering around any hotel by herself. Outside of the hotel, the Isla Verde section of San Juan/Carolina felt very safe during the day. My girlfriend and I walked around after dark, but always as a pair. As another reviewer mentioned, the police presence is significant. 2) Cleanliness - The hotel is very clean, especially the lobby and common area. The rooms and hallways were a bit rundown, but nothing glaring. The housekeeping staff kept our room in great shape, and they were incredibly good about fixing up our room while we were out on the beach. Not once did they knock while we were in the room. It was a pleasant surprise to come back to a tidy room and fresh towels each afternoon! Overall, the hotel was clean but slightly less pristine (i.e. standard-issue, budget hotel sparkle) than a Howard Johnson's in the continental U.S. 3) Affordability - We paid either $110 or $115 per night. Remember that they will stick you with heavy taxes above and beyond the stated rate. We got a few dollars off of the nightly Internet-advertised rate by calling and inquiring. We saw some of the slightly less expensive motels while we were there, and they looked dismal. However, if you want a step up from the HoJo, be prepared to shell out big bucks. There's not a lot of middle ground. 4) Beach access - This is a selling point. It takes less than a minute to walk from the hotel to the beach. The access alley was not dirty, contrary to a few other reviews. Even on busy days, the traffic on the street prevents you from crossing for mere seconds. The beach itself has clean sand and turquoise water. In late December, the water was fairly warm and clear. Not a lot of seaweed or other aquatic life visible. Christmas is a peak tourist time in San Juan, but the beach was never crowded. 5) The pool is lovely. It was immaculately clean and nearly always empty. It only reaches 4.5 feet in depth and is quite small, so not good for divers or lap swimmers. The only issue was that it broke for one day of our stay. However, they had it fixed within 24 hours. The ice cream parlor is now closed. They are adding a bar and music club in its place, so it's currently under renovations. That was a disappointment. If you're used to Holiday Inns, Sheratons, and Radissons on the mainland, you may find this Howard Johnson to be a bit on the lackluster side. Depends on whether you find a departure from corporate hotel chain monotony to be refreshing or risky. I felt like the HoJo was a good home base from which to explore the city and the beach. If you want to sip an umbrella drink in a fancy pool, go down the street to the luxurious Intercontinental. If you want a historical and unique hotel surrounded by shopping and dining, try El Convento in Old San Juan. (The bus to Old San Juan, by the way, picks you up for 25 cents across from the HoJo. It's a bit crowded and pick-ups aren't terribly frequent, but it's a great deal!) Food recommendations: -Steak and Co. restaurant has fantastic service and reasonably priced appetizers that doubled as an early dinner for us. -Golden Bagel Bakery has good variety for breakfast and lunch. Bagels aren't great, but the omelettes [and service] were. -The food at Ambrosia in Old San Juan was delicious, but the service was horrible. -We had a passable dinner at the Bohio, across from the Intercontinental. Kind of a glorified Italian joint with some good Latin options. -The ambience at the Intercontinental's outdoor cafe was great. We had dinner on a deck over the beach. Portions are huge! -Because rooms at the HoJo have fridges, we went to one of the two nearby grocery stores and bought some staple foods. It meant we didn't have to trek to find food each day at noon. More time on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, a good place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and a buddy stayed at the Howard Johnson in San Juan on 6/13/04. It's a good place to just lay your bags and get a decent rest for perhaps a night or two, without denting your wallet too much. Our first choice was a $60/night hotel, but after reading scary reviews for it here on tripadvisor, we decided to go with hojo for $100. At least you've heard of Howard Johnson so you got a good name backing it. Our room was small, but clean, and the location was excellent, right in isla verde and near some nice hotel/casinos like the intercontinental and the wyndham. If you're on a budget and are just looking for a place to put your bags, sleep, and stay clean, the Howard Johnson in San Juan is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a last minute decision”
Reviews.Author: Henna101
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend, his friend, and i decided to take our trip to San Juan at 3am with a flight which was leaving at 7 am. Howard Jhonson is what we came up with at 4Am with 3 hours remaining till our flight. No regrets! We had a fabulous room, great service! Our room was one of the only rooms in the entire hotel with a HUGE balcony looking over Isla Verde and the beach which is right across the street. Gorgeous! The location is excellent with a seven eleven on one side and Burger King on the other, both of which are open 24 hours. The guest services were so helpful and made our last minute getaway one to truly remember.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel for less”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The HJ was a fabulous hotel for what we wanted, a place to sleep. My sister, her friend and I stayed at HJ at the end of April for the first part of our trip and again at the end of our trip. it was our first trip to Puerto Rico we were going to visit her friend who lives in Aguadia. At first we booked a fancy hotel in the condado area only to hear that it was away from everything and that we would have to take a cab every day. So in the end even with the deal i got it was not cost efficient. A little more research and my sister found HJ. We decided that to be honest we were not going to be spending much time in the room anyway so why should we get a fancy room. It was 101 the first park of our vacation over the weekend and then 112 the second part of our vacation the weekend as well. The rooms were not huge but not small either. We got a room with 2 beds and the first 2 nights had a cot that I must say was not the most comfortable thing, u felt the springs, but cots are not meant to be cozy. The front desk staff was neither nice nor nasty. We met a hotel manager and he was really nice. And this hotel is safe, the only way you can get upstairs is by having a keycard that u must swipe in hte elevator and will only let u press the floor for which the key corisponds to.(new York hotels should think about that) We didnt bother trying the restaurant on the top floor, too expensive for us and italian food in puerto rico. This hotel was great location, the beach was across the street, u had a 7eleven right next door, u had 2 local clubs down the block, casinos down the block a walgreens open 24 hours down the block. A cockfighting ring a walk away as well as a denny's. If your looking to go out all the time and visit place and sight see and dont plan on spending a hell of a lot of time in your room I really do suggest you stay at the HJ great price for great location and friendly staff in the downstairs restaurant and ice cream parlor, yes that is right they have an ice cream parlor. If you're a hip hop fan checj out 2J's right down the block on friday and saturday nights, usually $5 bucks to get in beware of the dance offs they like those down there. And at 2 am the after hour clubs open and there is one a block past pizza city (dont eat there pizza) I forget the name of the club but on fridays and saturday nights its hot after 3am. The owners of both clubs are extremely nice and same with the bartenders. They will talk to you and you can make some friends down there, trust me we made friends everywhere down there simply because the people are soo friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Really really small room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I flew into San Juan (MAY 2004) and decided to stay at the Howard Johnson's because of the chain name and our experience was pretty good up until our stay at the HOJO in Carolina, PR. The room was very tiny. The bathroom was really gross and lacked big time. I didn't like the room at all. As far as price for accomadation, you are better off staying in an efficiency hotel for a lower rate and probably better accomadations. (YUK!!) The one good thing the Howard Johnson's in Isla Verde has is nice curb appeal, which by the way are the only pictures you will see. We will not be staying in Howard Johnson's, Isla Verde again unless they make some major improvements to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great but stay away from the restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the hotel,clean rooms,friendly staff.The restaurant on the top floor was a disaster.Should have known better.An Italian restaurant in Puerto Rico. Took over an hour for the arrival of our meal . The portions were small,prices high , food mediocre,and staff indifferent.Opt out on the bottled water.It was $6.00 per bottle and the only thing the staff was prompt on refilling. Party of 12 ,bill $440.00.Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; nice pool; fair price”
Reviews.Author: Anne_from_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Good value. Located between the airport and Old San Juan (and a block from the beach), this hotel is reasonably clean, the staff were helpful and efficient, and the pool was lovely. The attached restaurant on the first floor is also very good. I recommend the crab stuffed peppers appetizer.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Hotel Carolina/San Juan
HotelInfo.Address: 4820 Isla Verde Ave, Isla Verde 00979, Puerto Rico
